dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She EXITS. Indy SIGHS. Again, the obnoxious student SHOUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didja' get the name? VIRGIL! Capital V... I... R...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR THAD PRIESTLY enters, pushing Virgil aside. Pri young, wisecracking, greasy haired AQUAINTANCE of Indy's. photograph BENEATH Indy's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moby Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to photo) That's what I named 'im. Captain said it was the biggest fish he ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana GLANCES to the photo. It is a picture of Prof. Pr dressed in fisherman's outfit, standing on a pier, holdin FISH. Indy STEAMS. Priestly gives him a MANLY SLAP to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Jonesey? You were over in Scotty-land for two weeks... Didja' catch the big one?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Priestly... I'm real busy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is suddenly INTERRUPTED by a HARD SLAP to his face. A beautiful, blonde student, REBECCA, stands over his des SCREAMS. FURIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-timing bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana RUBS his jaw. STARTLED. Rebecca CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?!?... My own Mother?!?... In my own bed?!?... (slaps him again) I've had it with you! It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priestly HIDES his chuckle. Rebecca THROWS a shirt that o belongs to Indiana on the desk and STORMS out of the room his head and CONTINUES working. The students are still HA A LOUD VOICE ECHOES through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Delivery! Dr. Indiana Jones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burly POSTMAN stands in the doorway, holding a thick, e ENVELOPE. Indy MOTIONS to the postman. The Postman tries way through the crowd. Indiana goes back to his grading, suddenly INTERRUPTED BY A LOUD TAPPING NOISE. He LOOKS UP COVENTRY, a stately, elderly gentleman, RAPS a steel rule Indiana's desk. The Dean is UPSET. Very SERIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones, I've had complaints from several of the students --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Postman INTERRUPTS, dropping the heavy envelope onto The Postman SHOVES a yellow paper in front of Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy SIGNS. Dean Coventry continues LECTURING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They feel that you are ignoring them, that you are distracted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives Postman the signed paper) Me?... Distracted?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Indy's signature, puzzled) What's this? "B+"? That's how you sign your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy GRABS the paper. He's signed a "B+" on the LINE wher supposed to appear. Indy CROSSES out the grade and signs Professor Coventry still LECTURES Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall University is not the place for sloppy behavior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Indy OPENS the envelope! A LARGE AMOUNT O OUT! SATURATING the papers on the desk! This is followed ENORMOUS DEAD TROUT! It FLOPS onto Indy's desk. The stude STARTLED and NAUSEOUS glances. Indiana removes a water lo from the envelope. It reads, "A MACGOWAN'S WORD IS TRUER ANGEL'S KISS". Indiana uses a TISSUE to WIPE some of the his desk. Dean Coventry SHAKES A FINGER at Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have one final warning for you, Doctor Jones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PHONE RINGS! INTERRUPTING the Dean! Indiana quickly A phone. A FUMING Dean Coventry impatiently waits to finish Indiana SPEAKS into the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Oh, Hello, Marcus... Look, can you hold on?... (back to Dean) You were saying, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either you begin concentrating on your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupted by phone) Yes, Marcus... I'm still here... Just hold on! (back to Dean) I'm very sorry, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (boiling) -- concentrating on your teaching duties or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Damn it, Marcus! I'm standing here with Dean... What?.. Just how important?... (listening, impatient) It is, huh?... Okay. Five minutes. Yeah. I'll be right over. But this better be important, Marcus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana HANGS UP. He gives an EMBARASSED look to the furi faced Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are on probation, Jones! Ten days! If there is no improvement, you will be dismissed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dean STORMS OUT of the room. Indiana GATHERS the wet begins to EXIT the room, EXPLAINING to the students as he way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise...by tomorrow...I'll have all of these graded...and DRIED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana continues making APOLOGIES and EXCUSES. The obnox again SHOUTS at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIRGIL VEKTOR! Capital V... I... R...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him paper) "F"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil STARES at his paper, adorned with a large RED "F"! EXITS the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large room is filled with skeletons, fossils and stat back to the DAWN OF MAN. Indiana, his arms cluttered with term papers, hurriedly enters the museum with MARCUS BROD very ANXIOUS. EXCITED. He carries a l6MM METAL FILM CANNI his arm. Indiana is very IMPATIENT. His eyes dart to a fu skeleton of a TYRONOSAURUS REX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be important, Marcus... or the museum will soon be displaying my bones. My teaching career is in danger of extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You will not be disappointed, Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: AN ANCIENT PAINTING. The watercolor features an wrinkled face SUN WU KUNG, the STONE MONKEY KING. But the NOT made of stone. He appears to be HALF HUMAN... HALF MO face is WISE. His coal black eyes are PENETRATING. He wea SKIN ROBE, and holds a tall, GOLDEN HOOPED STAFF. Sun Wu amidst a garden of luscious, ripe PEACE TREES. He is surr HEAVENLY GLOW, a bright ray of light that emanates from a the CLOUDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK. We are inside of the museum BOARD ROOM holds the tattered painting before Indiana, who sits at a feverishly GRADING the wet term papers. After he finishes Indy PINS it to a nearby bulletin board for drying. He GL painting of Sun Wu Kung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sun wu Kung, The Stone Monkey King". Big deal. That was ten years ago, Marcus. (going back to papers, wanting to change subject) Geez! This Heller kid's got the worst grammar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years or fifty years. It will always be in your blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Marcus) Don't believe this... He spells "repeat" with two "E's".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think back, Indiana. Remember your desire? Your passion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still ignores Marcus) Kid gets an "A" on content...a "D" on form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, slams his fist on the desk) Damn it, man! You can't bury those feelings forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana finally LOOKS UP from the papers. He glances at M LOOKS at the painting. CAMERA DOLLIES INTO Indiana's face very SERIOUS. SOMBER. His eyes are EMPTY. Memories of FAI head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years. Nearly two years of my life...looking for the remains of that Monkey...a piece of his legendary Golden Hooped Rod...or some sign of the Lost City. (shakes his head) Nine men perished on the journey. Rest of us nearly died from starvation or one of the many horrible deseases we discovered... (looks back to papers, in a near whisper) We still came back empty handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threading the projector) One mustn't give up so easily, Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up?!?... Marcus, we spent thirteen months in China!...another seven in India!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But none in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled expression) There was no proof...archeological or anthropological...to indicate that Sun Wu-Kung ever visited Africa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus TURNS OFF the room lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... My papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus STARTS the projector. A BLACK AND WHITE image flic far wall. We see a PYGMY, standing in what appears to be area. The pygmy's name is TYKI. He is ADORABLE. A little FEET TALL, his body is TAUT, MUSCULAR. His long black hai his eyes are WIDE and BRIGHT. Almost CHILDLIKE. His face IMPISH. Covered with a very INQUISITIVE expression. Tyki' BOUNDLESS. He cannot stop MOVING. Standing BESIDE Tyki, i DR. CLARE CLARKE. 32 years old. A tall, strikingly BEAUTI She is COMMUNICATING with Tyki in sign language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is Dr. Clare Clarke. The famous zoologist. She works in Africa, studying animals in their natural habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very interesting, Marcus. Now if you'll turn the lights back on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Three weeks ago, Dr. Clarke discovered that cute little fellow... "Tyki"...a pygmy of an unusual race...unrelated to any known African tribe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bored) Marcus. The lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Clarke believes that Tyki comes from the Lost Civilization of Sun Wu-Kung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana PAUSES. He STANDS, walking closer to the flickeri Suddenly INTERESTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... But how did Miss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Doctor".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Doctor" Clake. How did she arrive at such a preposterous hypothesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pygmy speaks in a language that has no African origins...but bears a strong resemblance to Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means nothing. The rivers of Africa have been plagued by various Oriental Pirates and Scavengers since the 16th Century. (turns from screen) Not much evidence, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. The pygmy was found wearing an ornamental peach stone around his neck...believed to come from Sun Wu-Kung's legendary Garden Of Immortal Peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Marcus, there are countless undiscovered African tribes...all with various obscure beliefs and practices... (smirks) One tribe may wear peach stones... another may wear banana peels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana WALKS back to his papers. Marcus PAUSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one final bit of evidence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlighten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pygmy is over 200 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana ADJUSTS his spectacles. He STARES at the black an image. The cute pygmy appears to be in his MID-TWENTIES. the CAMERA, STARING into the lens. Tyki examines the came CURIOSITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Clarke has done a considerable amount of testing on the pygmy's clothing...his sandals...everything was over 200 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) He's probably wearing his Great Grandfather's stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS BACK to the projected image. Tyki begins to U camera lens. The picture goes OUT OF FOCUS. The film RUNS TURNS OFF the projector and flips ON the overhead room li gives Marcus a PUZZLED look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does all of this have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Clarke wants to mount an expedition to find the Lost City of Sun Wu-Kung. She is quite familiar with your reputation...she'd like you to come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gathering his papers) No chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be money involved... The museum is willing to fund the expedition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Marcus. I've burned this bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana TURNS and begins to WALK out of the room. Marcus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy TURNS. He WAVES the papers at Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus. Please. I've got to finish these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to finish something much more important. You crossed the threshold over a decade ago...and it's been tearing at your insides ever since. (passionate) My friend, if there is even one iota of truth in Dr. Clarke's findings... then you can lift the veil of mystery that has surrounded this Chinese legend for Centuries. You may uncover the secrets to a Lost Civilization...and possibly, to man's never ending search for immortality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana STARES at the painting of Sun Wu Kung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana... Can you afford to pass up the single most important adventure of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana has NO ANSWER for Marcus. Indy PICKS up the paint THRILLING expression slowly covers Indiana's face. His ey Filled with a long, lost EXCITEMENT. The SOUND TRACK MUSI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers are slightly CRUMPLED. Still WET. A DROP OF WA papers. CAMERA PANS UPWARD. BETSY TUFFET, Indy's student sits at the desk, grading the papers. She is CRYING. Her soak the papers. We are INSIDE of Indiana's apartment. LA evening. INDIANA stands in the background. He is hurriedly PACKING His familiar GUN, HAT and WHIP lie on the bed, beside the Indy NOTICES that Betsy is crying. He WALKS to Betsy. Ind arm on Betsy's shoulder, attempting to COMFORT her. Betsy Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking tears off the papers) C'mon, Betsy. Relax. You're gettin' 'em all wet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't go away...I mean... Africa is so far away, and...well... (heartfelt) I love you, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we agreed this was s'posed to be casual...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call what happened last night "casual".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear...a momentary lapse into passion does not a love affair make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very upset) Momentary lapse! So that's all I am to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betsy SHOOTS to her feet, walking OFF SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betsy... Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana SIGHS. His eye CATCHES one of the termpapers. He READ, making a few CORRECTIONS. We see Betsy's HAND removes Indiana's WHIP from the bed. Indiana continues to CORRECT the papers. Suddenly, there NOISE. Indy TURNS. His face goes WHITE. He runs OFF SCREE One end of Indiana's WHIP is attached to an OVERHEAD LAMP DOWN the whip. The other end has been formed into a NOOSE Betsy's neck. Sbe stands on a wooden CHAIR. She KICKS AWA Suddenly GAGGING. Indiana GRABS Betsy in midair. He TAKES from her neck and PLACES Betsy on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Whatsa' matter with you!... Tryin' to ruin my whip!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can't have you... I don't want to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana TOSSES the whip into his suitcase. He pulls up th forces Betsy to be SEATED. He pours her a tall glass of B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink this. You'll feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana WALKS to his suitcase, continuing to pack. His BA Betsy. She raises the GLASS to her lips. She PAUSES, read on the Bourbon bottle. It reads: DANGER! CONTENTS FLAMMAB BEAMS. An IDEA. She LIFTS the bottle over her head and be her body with the liquid. Indiana is BUSY folding his clothing. Suddenly, we hear t MATCHSTICK! Indy TURNS. He sees the bourbon covered Betsy LIGHT HER BODY ON FIRE! Indy DASHES forward. He BLOWS OUT moments before it SPARKS Betsy's clothing. Indy SHAKES Be shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Betsy... Get a hold of yourself. You're young. There are a lot of other guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (succumbing to his ego) That's true... (realizing his mistake) But that's no reason to stop living! Besides, I'm too old for you. By the time you're seventy five, I'll be... (calculates, the thought of it makes him grimace) Yeccchhh! I'll be disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana TURNS and finishes his packing. Betsy SIGHS. She enormous, STONE AFRICAN URN. The 150 POUND antique sits a of BOOKSHELVES. Meanwhile, Indiana makes certain that his gun is PACKED. familiar HAT on his head and begins to CLOSE the suitcase CLOSE UP: THE AFRICAN URN. It is WOBBLING. SHAKING. Movin CLOSER to the edge of the bookshelves. CAMERA PANS TO THE LIES here. Directly BELOW the trembling urn. Betsy SHAKES bookshelves, causing the urn to TILT and SHIVER. The urn HALFWAY OFF of the edge. If it falls...the urn will CRUSH head. Indiana STRUGGLES with closing his tightly packed suitcas The urn FALLS! HEADED STRAIGHT for Betsy! Indiana SUDDENL urn. In MIDAIR. Inches before it STRIKES Betsy. Indiana R on the floor. He HELPS Betsy to her feet. Betsy WRAPS her around Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me, Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana PICKS UP his suitcase and tries to WALK to the do Betsy's arms are still TIGHTLY WRAPPED around him. Finall STOPS. His eyes BURN through Betsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cruel) Look... You're just a flighty kid. Twenty minutes after I walk out this door, you'll have a date with the college Romeo. Two hours from now, you'll be madly in love with him. By tomorrow, you'll forget I ever existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt, Betsy REMOVES her arms from Indiana. He gives her a to the cheek and hurriedly EXITS. Betsy GLARES at the clo TOUGH, ANGRY expression covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never underestimate the determination of a Brooklyn girl, Doctor Jones. Never.

dialogues.speaker: AN OCEAN LINER
dialogues.text: The SILHOUETTE of the ship sails across the water. A beau SKY fills the background.

dialogues.speaker: INDIANA JONES
dialogues.text: stands aboard the ship's DECK. It is a typical, 30's LUXU liner, filled with vacationing TOURISTS. Indiana STARES i sunrise. His face is a study in CONCENTRATION and INTENSI anxiously AWAITS his adventure.

dialogues.speaker: MAP OF THE WORLD
dialogues.text: A MOVING RED LINE traces Indiana's journey across the oce AFRICA. The red line comes to a stop at MOZAMBIQUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief PORT on the coast. Gateway to the ZAMBESI RIVER. SU SAILBOATS and RAFTS line the marina. The docks are crowde various MERCHANTS and SAILORS, unloading their goods. Sma RESTAURANTS clutter the waterfront. Behind them are rows low square HOMES. Tall, healthy PALM TREES surround the A An OCEAN LINER has anchored along the shore. Several PASS from the ship. INDIANA steps onto the ocean liner's exit UNSHAVEN, wearing his traditional LEATHER JACKET and HAT. AROUND, expecting to MEET someone.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCK
dialogues.text: There is a a LOUD CAR HORN. Crowds of pedestrians LEAP ou A rusted, yellow MODEL-T barrels along the rickety dock. "TAXI" is crudely painted on the car's trembling doors. T tires are WOBBLING. LOOSE. Thick, black SMOKE pours from EXHAUST PIPE. The ancient car RATTLES and GRINDS. Upon seeing the car, Indiana SMILES. At the foot of the ocean liner's ramp, the car SCREECHES

dialogues.speaker: SCRAGGY BRIER
dialogues.text: Indiana's friend and guide, JUMPS out of the taxi. Scragg unkempt AFRICAN MAN. An elderly fellow, with the ENERGY a of a youth. His snow white hair and beard are WILD. SPIKE TATTERED, DIRTY clothes that are many sizes too large for body. Homemade CROCODILE SANDALS flop on his feet. Scraggy suddenly breaks into a WILD GRIN. He SPOTS Indian SHOOTS up the exit ramp, running through the crowd of peo stops a FEW FEET in front of Indiana. Scraggy WAVES his a him, as if he were BLESSING Indiana. Following this, Scra into Indy's arms. Indiana CRADLES Scraggy like a child. S a Portugese accent, Scraggy EXCLAIMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy! At last we are reunited! (looks to sky) Oh, Keechingo, God Of Friendship...I thank you for granting my wish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy RESTS Scraggy back onto the ramp. Scraggy MOVES to a with his luggage. Before picking it up, Scraggy RAISES hi the baggage. Again, he BLESSES the suitcases. Scraggy the the bags. Indy CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you haven't changed, Scraggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mahootmek, God Of Goodness, say... "Before body make contact with foreign object...one must cast out bad spirits, or -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " -- or bad spirits will enter your body!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! You have excellent memory, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should! Last time we saw each other...you made me wear the same clothes for 3 weeks straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never separate body from clothes, or bad spirits will hide in pockets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words... If people never changed clothes...there would be no evil in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles, puts his arm around Scraggy) I missed all a' your crazy philosophies, Scraggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They not so crazy, Indy. (serious, eyes wide with fear) These days... There is much evil in the air. I feel it. Everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Scraggy CONTINUE to walk down the ramp, moving O CAMERA PANS TO A FEW FEET BEHIND THEM. CAMERA STOPS, as t

dialogues.speaker: FILLED WITH A LARGE, BLAZING RED SWASTIKA
dialogues.text: that this is the SLEEVE OF A GERMAN SOLDIER. CAMERA STOPS of

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HELMUT GUTTERBUHG
dialogues.text: A thin, skeletal NAZI. He resembles the ANGEL OF DEATH. G face is NARROW and SUNKEN. His deep set eyes are a fright BLUE. His complexion is PALE. EMOTIONLESS. His hair is BL STRINGY. His right arm appears RIGID. It rests STIFFLY at Gutterbuhg FOLLOWS Indy and Scraggy through the crowd. Th REMOVES something from his pocket. It is a tiny, MECHANIC resembles a COCKROACH. We see that it is a mini RADIO TRA Gutterbuhg WHISPERS into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, English subtitles) Are we making contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mechanical roach's eyes BLINK RED. Gutterbuhg gives a SMILE. Meanwhile, Indiana and Scraggy ARRIVE at the Taxi. Scragg SECURE Indy's baggage to the roof. Indy OPENS the rear do cab. He begins to CLIMB into the back seat. He is met wit KICK TO THE STOMACH! He FALLS to the ground. The wind KNO him. Scraggy RUNS to the open door, scolding the person I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Clarke! Why you kick Dr. Jones?...

dialogues.speaker: DR. CLARE CLARKE
dialogues.text: STEPS OUT of the shadows of the car. We RECOGNIZE her fro film, but she is even MORE BEAUTIFUL in person. She is th Indy. Her hair is BRIGHT RED. She removes her glasses, re sparkling GREEN EYES. She is very PRIM. Very PROPER. But INTELLIGENT and QUICK WITTED. She is dressed in KHAKI SLA SHIRT. She speaks in a slight BRITISH ACCENT. She hurried Indiana to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones! Forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I was being attacked by a degenerate sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just a degenerate archeologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your appearance is deceiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a handshake and a SMILE. Immediately ATTRAC other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana Jones! Calling passenger Indiana Jones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana TURNS. A ship PORTER walks through the crowd, pus BARREL on a dolly. Indy WAVES to the Porter. The Porter S of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left this aboard ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) There must be some mistake... I didn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porter POINTS to a section of the barrel that reads: DR. INDIANA JONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's you, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah...but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porter DROPS the barrel in front of Indiana and hurri back to the ship. SGT. GUTTERBUHG continues to SPY on Indiana. The Nazi HID away. In a DARK alleyway. A puzzled Indiana begins to OPEN the barrel. Scraggy SHOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy! Remember Mahootmek, God Of Goodness! "Before body make contact with foreign object -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana IGNORES Scraggy and begins to PRY OPEN the barrel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...you must cast out bad spirits!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana still IGNORES Scraggy. He STRUGGLES with the barr FLIRTING with Clare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I call you "Clare"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Clare... We've obviously got a lot of notes to compare... Let's get started tonight...over dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of mine owns a Cafe... He'll get us a nice quiet table. No disturbances. Just the two of us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, the barrel lid FLIES OFF! The inside if F old, brown BANANA PEELS. Suddenly, BETSY'S HEAD POKES THR peels! Indiana is SHOCKED. Scraggy SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warn you, Indy! You must always cast out bad spirits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirty, unkempt Betsy LEAPS OUT OF THE BARREL! She THROW around Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My precious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled, to Indy) Your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (revolted) A child!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clare) It's nothing. Really. (to Betsy) What the hell are you doing here'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proving my love for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How terribly sordid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clare) Puppy love. Schoolgirl crush. She'll get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. This proves that nothing can come between us. Not an ocean. Not two separate Continents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'm going to be ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled, to Betsy) How...I mean... How could you stay alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I'm from Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we'ye been sailing for three weeks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stowed away in the banana barrel. Ate my way to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nauseous) Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Clare) Hey, Indy... Who's the babe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your intellectual and emotional superior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...well you're gettin' on my nerves, Miss... Miss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extends her hand) "Doctor" Clare Clarke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly shaking Clare's hand) Betsy Tuffet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in curds and whey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting tough) Listen, sister... You better stay away from Indy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, he has no interest in me. I've already celebrated my tenth Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana SHOOTS Clare an angry glance. Indy removes a wad his pocket. He GIVES them to Betsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Betsy... Why don't you get back on the boat... This time, as a passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy points toward the OCEAN LINER. The boat is SEVERA shore. It SAILS back out to sea. Indiana STEAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the next one out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana GRUMBLES. An amused Dr. Clarke gets back into the SHOVES Betsy inside. He is FURIOUS. Before Indiana gets into the car, GUTTERBUHG steps out fr alleyway. He TOSSES the tiny mechanical COCKROACH at Indi roach ATTACHES itself to Indy's TROUSER LEG. The tiny tra very LIGHT. Indiana can feel NOTHING. He gets INTO the ca BLESSES the Taxi and gets into the driver's seat. Gutterbuhg WATCHES as the battered Model-T DRIVES OFF. Th walking in an opposite direction. The CAMERA FOLLOWS Gutt enters a SEEDY WATERFRONT HOTEL.

SEVERAL are seated before the equipment, monitoring various radio enormous GLASS PANEL covers one wall. THROUGH THE PANEL W

The cars are enormous, beautiful "WOODIE with a RUNNING BOARD and WOOD PANELLED SIDES. The cars GL NEW. Gutterbuhg turns to KLAUS, a hulking Nazi who stands in t Pointing to Klaus' FEET, Gutterbuhg SHOUTS an order to Kl PANS to Klaus' feet. The Nazi's BOOT IS UNTIED. A LONG ST on the floor. The embarassed Klaus KNEELS and sloppily RE shoe. Gutterbuhg turns to a Nazi who sits at a RADIO RECEIVER. wears HEADPHONES, LISTENING for a transmission. THE LONG, SHADOW OF A MAN overcomes Gutterbuhg. He TURNS. FEAR cove Gutterbuhg's face. The shadow RAISES its arm. HEIL HITLER also RAISES his right arm. But a BIZARRE, MECHANICAL SQUE by the movement of his arm.

NO eyelashes. Completely BALD. His body is THIC He is over SIX FEET TALL. He GLARES down at Gutterbuhg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

A high, pitched BEAUTIFUL VOICE. Clare w far end of the compound, toward the SINGING. The others F walks by BONZO, A LARGE CHIMPANZEE. As Betsy PASSES, the a FAMILIAR SMELL. Betsy MOVES to go inside, but Bonzo's HAND REACHES OUT and GRABS BETSY! PULLING the girl OFF SC

dialogues.text: Filled with hand made wooden and bamboo FURNITURE. TYKI, PYGMY from Marcus' film, is INSIDE. Tyki is dressed only leather loin cloth and SANDALS. He is perched on the floo a large TAPESTRY. The tapestry depicts a colorful picture The buildings of a LARGE CITY are REFLECTED on the clouds pleasantly SINGS as he does his work. Upon hearing the cage door OPEN, Tyki LOOKS UP. He SEES C JOYOUS SMILE covers his face. The pygmy RUNS to Clare, gi huge HUG and a KISS. Clare INTRODUCES Tyki to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyki... This is Doctor Jones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyki EXTENDS his right hand. He SHAKES Indiana's hand. In CHARMED by the civilized display of friendship. Indy SMIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a real gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Just basic manners. What it takes most men a lifetime to learn... Tyki's accomplished in two weeks. (introduces Scraggy) This is our guide, Scraggy Brier... and Miss Bets--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare pauses, noticing that Betsy is MISSING. Clare sudde into a LAUGH! She points OFF SCREEN. Everyone TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonzo is being extremely AFFECTIONATE toward Betsy. The c PULLS and GRABS at Betsy. It is all VERY SIMILIAR to what been doing to Indiana. Betsy WRESTLES with Bonzo, CALLING help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone CHUCKLES at Betsy's dillemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears that Bonzo is attracted to Miss Tuffet's Derfume... Eau De Banana Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyki has gone back to his ARTWORK. A FASCINATED Indiana l pygmy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find him?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten miles from here. We were on a photographic expedition...in the thick of the jungle... I heard sounds. Whimpering. Moaning. I took a few steps, and found Tyki. He was lying in a shallow swamp...semi conscious...a high fever...nearly dead from exhaustion. He had obviously been travelling on foot for many days, over countless miles... So I brought him back to the compound...nursed him back to health...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana STARES at the pygmy. A skeptical look COVERS his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare, I hate to quibble with your anthropological abilities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quibble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but if this little fellow is over 200 years old... I mean... What accounts for his youthful appearance?...his vitality?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare OPENS a door at the rear of the cage. It LEADS into room, directly behind the CAGE. Clare and Indiana ENTER. behind. He EXCHANGES a friendly smile with Tyki. Meanwhil BACKGROUND, we see BETSY and the CHIMPANZEE. They ROLL BY ground. Still WRESTLING. CLOSE UP: PEACE STONE. A FRUIT FLY crawls along the peach pit's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyki was wearing this when I found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK. We are in a SMALL, STERILE ROOM. The p rests on a TABLE. Indiana and Clare STAND over the stone. UP the stone, examining it. An annoying FRUIT FLY buzzes head. CAMERA PANS DOWN to Indiana's trouser leg. The RADI is still attached to his pants. The tiny bug's eyes BLINK

dialogues.speaker: SGT. GUTTERBUHG.
dialogues.text: He stands inside of Nazi Headquarters, huddled over the R VOICES of Indiana and Clare echo over the speaker. Gutter FURIOUSLY transcribes the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones, you are obviously familiar with the legend of Sun Wu- King's Garden of Immortal Peaches?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bite from the fruit of that peach tree would give a person eternal life...make them forever young...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vicious Gutterbuhg SMILES. CAMERA PANS to his noteboo underlines the words "FOREVER YOUNG".

dialogues.speaker: INDIANA
dialogues.text: STUDYING the peach pit. The fruit fly continues to BUZZ a Indiana's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing unusual about this ...nothing to indicate that it's from Sun Wu Kung's garden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fruit fly LANDS on Indiana's neck. Indy SMACKS the fl it! A SHOCKED Clare RUNS to Indiana. She GRABS his hand a removes what remains of the fruit fly. She GLARES at Indi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fruit fly had a normal life- span of TWENTY FOUR HOURS. (frustrated sigh) As an experiment...the fly was put in this room...alone...with only the peach stone to sustain its existence. The fly stayed alive for THREE WEEKS. (looks at dead fly) Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She FLICKS the'fly against the wall. Indy gives an EMBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Clare are suddenly INTERRUPTED by the sound o Tyki's LAUGHTER. This is followed by the two of them havi DISCUSSION! In Tyki's FOREIGN TONGUE! Clare and Indy exch SHOCKED GLANCE and DASH out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy and Tyki are having a CONVERSATION. Clare POINTS giving a PUZZLED LOOK to Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Scraggy knows hundreds of languages... He's the best guide in Africa. (turns to Scraggy) Ask Tyki where he came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy NODS and ASKS Tyki. Tyki ANSWERS and POINTS to th the clouds. Scraggy TRANSLATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say... "I come from 'Land Of City On Clouds'".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Huh?... What the hell's that s'posed to mean? (to Scraggy) Can he take us there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy ASKS Tyki. Tyki ANSWERS. He and Scraggy LAUGH hys Scraggy LOOKS at Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say if he could... He would go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyki OFFERS some more information to Scraggy. Scraggy TRA

dialogues.text: He say "Pai Cho" may help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana's eyes WIDEN. STARTLED. AMAZED. Clare LOOKS at In

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pai Cho"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sacres Proverbs and Writings of Sun Wu Kung. (anxious, looking at Scraggy) His disciples always carry the Pai Cho with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy ASKS Tyki. The pygmy NODS and REMOVES his belt. W the thick belt actually unravels into a CLOTH SCROLL. Tyk scroll and GIVES it to Scraggy. Scraggy nervously OPENS t is filled with countless ANCIENT CHINESE WRITINGS and PRO Indiana STARES over Scraggy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you translate it?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy NODS. Indiana's eyes ANXIOUSLY scan the document. BREATHLESS. EXCITED. The SOUND TRACK MUSIC SOARS. Suddenly, BETSY AND THE CHIMPANZEE FALL INTO FRAME! ON TO SCROLL! Bonzo STRADDLES Betsy, trying to move his lips TO She is SCREAMING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get...him...off...of...me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonzo moves its lips to Betsy and gives her a BIG KISS! S GRIMACES. Finally, Clare begins to make BIZARRE MONKEY HA and SOUNDS. Bonzo TURNS. He UNDERSTANDS Clare. She contin COMMUNICATE with the chimp, until Bonzo turns and RUNS ou cage! Indiana and Scraggy exchange an IMPRESSED GLANCE. B the kiss from her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads: "DASHIELL'S AMERICAN BAR". It adorns the front Mozambique NIGHTCLUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIMLY lit. SMOKY. Filled with cloth covered TABLES and or AFRICAN furnishings. A 9 piece JAZZ BAND plays SWING TUNE couples SWAY on the dance floor. The place is swarming wi Many are SEATED at the bar. Others are scattered at vario throughout the restaurant. Some stand in CORNERS. Lurking SHADOWS. They are all looking in one direction, watching INDIANA JONES. Indy sits with Scraggy, Clare and Betsy, at a table near the restaurant. They are eating DINNER. But Indy, Scraggy are more interested in the Stone Monkey SCROLLS. A very N Scraggy TRANSLATES. Indiana, wearing his spectacles, take pages of NOTES. Searching for a CLUE. An INTERESTED Clare Indiana's shoulder. Betsy tries to become INCLUDED in the But everyone IGNORES her. Scraggy continues to TRANSLATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sun Wu Kung run like fire, He journey to Many Monkey Land, To build his final empire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Sun Wu-Kung?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Betsy, to Scraggy) Many Monkey Land... That's a definite reference to Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Africa?... He journeyed to Africa?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also ignores Betsy, to Indiana) That confirms our suspicions that he may have formed his Civilization here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What civilization?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, to Betsy) Betsy. Keep your trap shut. This doesn't concern you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) Fine. Terrific. Who cares about this stuff anyway! We're in a nightclub. We should be havin' fun. (grabs Indiana's hand) C'mon, Indy. Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a buncha' stiffs! (condescending, to Clare) Bet you can't dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the contrary...I spent several months studying dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Whattayou' know?... The Bunny Hop?... The Jitterbug?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) The Bondogea. The Kyebe Kyebe. The Dungumaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: African Tribal dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. They're beyond the spectrum of your microscopic world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insulted, Betsy GOBBLES down her glass of wine and TURNS Indiana, who is still deeply CONCENTRATING on the scrolls

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Betsy's FOOT reaches across the floor. It RESTS on Indy's begins to RUB against Indiana's trouser leg. The red eyed BUG is still attached to Indiana's trousers.

dialogues.speaker: INDIANA
dialogues.text: GLARES at Betsy. Clare REACHES for her cup of coffee. She the coffee cup trembles SLIGHTLY. Clare GLANCES beneath t sees Betsy RUBBING Indy's leg. Clare is DISGUSTED. ABOVE the table, Clare shoots a scowl of DISAPPROVAL at I FLUSTERED Indy tries to explain...but is suddenly INTERRU hand on his shoulder. It is DASHIELL, the suave, HANDSOME restaurant. Dashiell gives a CaARMING SMILE to everyone a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoying your dinners?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone NODS, expressing their thanks. Dashiell LEANS cl Indiana and WHISPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself, sport. Most of the talk here tonight is about you. And it isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana's eyes DART around the room. He sees the VARIOUS WATCHING him. Indy gives a CONFIDENT SMILE. A WORRIED Das continues WHISPERING to Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you've done to the Nazis. But they are certainly no friends of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARK. SILENT. Many of the animals are ASLEEP in their cag SECURITY GUARD keeps watch on the compound. He STANDS out METAL GATES. There is a SUDDEN SOUND. The guard TURNS. THE FIGURES OF THREE MEN stand before him. In the SHADOWS Guard places a hand on his holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a MECHANICAL CREAK. A MAN'S LEATHER GLOVED HAND e the shadows. The hand's FINGER is POINTED at the Security

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of RAPID MACHINE GUN FIRE echoes throughout the RECORDS the animal's SHOCKED REACTIONS!

dialogues.speaker: THE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: lies on the GROUND. DEAD. His body riddled with BULLETS. BLACK BOOTS of the three men PASS his body. We notice tha boot's SHOELACES are untied.

dialogues.speaker: TYKI
dialogues.text: STARES into the dark night. FEAR covers his face. He is S of his cage. A CANDLE flickers beside him. Tyki's hands R beautiful tapestry. Tyki LISTENS. He hears FOOTSTEPS. COM his cage. Tyki REACHES to his side. He grabs a STONE DAGG Suddenly, a LOOD GONSHOT! The SPLINTERED LOCK from Tyki's spinning across the floor. The cage door CREAKS OPEN. GUTTERBUHG stands in the doorway. TWO NAZI SOLDIERS, HELM (who we met earlier), are beside him. Gutterbuhg SMILES. right arm EXTENDS from his side. His leather gloved INDEX POINTING ahead. Tyki GROWLS at the Nazis. He STANDS. RAISING the stone da HEAD. Gutterbuhg's FINGER BEGINS TO RAPIDLY FIRE BULLETS! His M is actually a A MACEINE GUN! The bullets TEAR through Tyki's tapestry. They make a cro tattered line through the BEAUTIFOL WORK. DESTROYING it. Tyki WATCHES. Gutterbuhg STOPS shooting. He REMOVES the empty cartridge in his mechanical arm, and REPLACES it with another. He p DEADLY FINGER at Tyki. A trembling Tyki DROPS the dagger. NAZIS walk toward the helpless pygmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana, Scraggy and Clare CONTINUE to excitedly STUDY th NEGLECTED Betsy POURS herself the last of the wine. She i singing along with the band's version of Cole Porter's "N Day".

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Betsy continues to RUB her FOOT against Indiana's leg.

dialogues.speaker: INDIANA
dialogues.text: tries to IGNORE Betsy's playing. Scraggy continues to TRA scroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "With his Golden Hooped Rod, And its powerful lightning rays, Sun Wu Kung build Water Curtain Cave, Where he live for 500 days."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golden Hooped Rod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavenly staff with many different powers...most notably, it had the ability to transform itself into hundreds of objects... (staring) It remains the most priceless treasure of Sun Wu Kung's empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is the...the Water Curtain Cave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Wu Kung's legendary hideout...an enormous secret cave, hidden behind a running waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare again REACHES for her coffee. The cup and saucer ar TREMBLING. Clare PEEKS under the table, and again SEES Be RUBBING Indiana's leg. Clare gives a revolted GRUMBLE. In EXCITEDLY explains Scraggy's translation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This proves that the Water Curtain Cave exists in Africa... (to Scraggy) Does it mention anything about Sun Wu Kung's travels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading scroll) Only place called..."Twisted Snake Water".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zarnbesi River! It has a reputation for its deadly water snakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have been Sun Wu Kung's logical path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confident, anxious) It will also be our logical path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Betsy's foot CONTINUES to rub Indiana's leg. Finally Indy down, trying to SLAP Betsy's foot away! But Indy's hand S something else. The MECHANICAL BUG. Indy TRIES to remove the tiny device WON'T BUDGE.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE TABLE
dialogues.text: Indiana's hand is buried beneath the table, STRUGGLING to bug. To Clare, it appears as if Indy is PLAYING with Bets Clare gives an INCREDULOUS look to Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please try to control that monstrous libido of yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana finally REMOVES the mechanical bug. He LIFTS it a table. EXAMINING it. Clare is about to ASK a question. In for her to "Shhhh". He COVERS the bug and WHISPERS to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get back to the compound. Tyki may be in danger.

dialogues.text: Can we at least jump in the water?... Go for a swim?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old legend about the Zambesi... In ancient times, criminals were given their choice of execution...or swimming across the Zambesi. Most chose execution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare's right. We'll be safer on the boat. (annoyed, to Betsy) Now quit moanin' and eat your food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so rude! I travel thousands of miles just to be with you...and everybody treats me like dirt! (to Clare) Nobody even talks to me without making some condescending remark they think I'm too stupid to understand! (very upset) So maybe I don't know a lot about weird tribal dances... I'm still pretty good with anthropology and archeology... Maybe I could even help you out...if somebody gave me a chance...clued me in to what it is we're doin' here... (to Indy) 'Cause whether you like it or not, Indiana Jones... I'm part of this expedition, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana SIGHS. The crew member's GUITAR PLAYING COMBINES SOUND TRACK, backing up Indiana's story with an EERIE TUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long ago...a place known as the Flower Fruit Mountain, in the Chinese province of Ao-Lai...was struck by lightning. A Stone Monkey, "Sun Wu-Kung", was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This monkey?... He could walk?... Talk?... Like human?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than human. He was blessed with countless heavenly powers... But it wasn't enough. Sun Wu-Kung wanted to learn the secret of Eternal Life... of Immortality... (pause) Equipped with his Golden Hooped Rod to protect him, Sun Wu Kung travelled the world for many years ...learning the secret philosophies and teachings of Eternal Youth. Eventually, he was granted entrance to heaven...where the Jade Emperor gave Sun Wu Kung the title of "Great Sage of the Heavens"...and permitted him to oversee the Garden of Immortal Peaches. (pause) After several years, the stone monkey returned to somewhere on earth. Here, he ruled an empire...a Civilization of Monkeys and humans who had life spans of many hundred years... (shrugs) The exact whereabouts of that Lost City has been a mystery for hundreds of years...until Doctor Clarke discovered the pygmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew members, Scraggy, Betsy and Clare, listen with F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's uncertain just how much of this legend is based in reality... Nevertheless, we're hoping to find some sign of the Lost Civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Sun Wu Kung?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever he was...a stone idol...an actual monkey...a human being...is unknown. But he is one of the most influentual religious figures in History, and his remains are most likely somewhere in the Lost City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, they are INTERRUPTED BY A DISTANT SOUND. A LOW, SOUND. BIZARRE. UNEARTHLY. UNLIKE anything we've heard be TURNS to Scraggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) It is far, far away...many miles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) What is it?... Some kinda' weird animal?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No animal sounds like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be "Banseebaba".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banseebaba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banseebaba is giant demon from hell. He is 50 feet tall. Breathes fire. Make sound like human never hear before. He is made up of all evil in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheery thought.

dialogues.text: The boat sails along the RIVER. Beneath the MOONLIGHT. A MEMBER stays awake. At the STEERING WHEEL. Other CREW MEM along the deck. Scraggy SLEEPS in a hanging cot.

Indy WAKES out of bed and TACKLES the mysterious person. Indy FLIPS lamp. The intruder is none other than...BETSY. Indiana PU her feet. She gives a flirtatious SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep. The heat. I'm in the mood for passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the mood for isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana LEADS Betsy to the open door. He begins to PUSH h outside. Betsy STOPS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving. Not till I get a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betsy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious) One kiss. Or I'll scream. I swear. I'll wake the whole boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana has NO CHOICE. He SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OKay. Just one. (leans toward her, pauses) Keep your mouth closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They KISS. Betsy WRAPS her arms around Indiana, turning i PASSIONATE KISS. At that moment, ACROSS THE HALL, Clare exits the bathroom in hand. She SEES the kissing Indiana and Betty. Clare LOCKING the door behind her, and moving a piece of front of the door. Indiana PUSHES Betsy away. ANGRY. He q his door. Betsy WALKS back to her room. A huge, SATISFIED her face.

dialogues.text: What does it say?...

dialogues.text: (translating) "Our Lord... Our Master... Sun... Wu... Kung"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SOUND TRACK MUSIC RISES. It is the tomb of the STONE Clare exchanges an AWE INSPIRED glance with Betsy, then l still body of Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Jones! Why couldn't you be here to share this with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pygmies begin to LOWER the dead bodies, including Ind Bohbala, into the ground. Tyki reads from ANCIENT SCRIPTU SOBS on the shoulder of Kezure, who continues to stare in at the peach trees. Suddenly, there is a RUMBLING SOUND. Followed by a slight trees begin to SWAY, as a HOWLING WIND rushes through the of Sun Wu Kung GLOWS with a BRIGHT LIGHT. The glass surro tomb suddenly SHATTERS. The skeleton's head TURNS. Its bo Beginning to MOVE. The skeleton STEPS OUT OF THE TOMB. Everyone STARES in awe. TERRIFIED. The skeleton takes a FEW STEPS forward, STOPS, and RAISES HIGH in the air. The skeleton OPENS its mouth. Emitting a ...UNEARTHLY...SCREECH! An ectoplasmic GREEN SMOKE seeps skeleton's fingers, slowly TRAVELING over the heads of th ectoplasm separates into several INDIVIDUAL LINES, that t upon EACH OF THE GORILLAS. The ectoplasm ENCIRCLES each t bodies. The Gorillas begin to RISE from the ground. HIGH The ectoplasm appears to be CARRYING them toward Sun Wu K Gorillas TRAVEL through the air, their bodies begin to SH SMALLER. THINNER. The humans stare into the SKY. Watching the AMAZING, MAGI TRANSFORMATION. As the Gorillas get CLOSER to Sun Wu Kung, their bodies h to TINY, HAIR-LIKE substances. When the Gorillas ARRIVE a skeleton, they ATTACH themselves to his body. We see that Gorillas are actually individual HAIRS on the skeleton's countless hairs CONVERGE, the skeleton begins to take SHA SUN WU KUNG COMES TO LIFE! He is UNLIKE anyone or anythin ever seen. HALF-HUMAN. HALF-HONKEY. His face is covered w His wide eyes are COAL BLACK. PROBING. WARM. When he smil DEVILISH, but incredibly CHARMING. His movements are PERK extremely ADORABLE little fellow. Instantly LOVABLE. But STRONG, POWERFUL presense about him. He is indeed, a HEAV Sun Wu Kung LOOKS over the congregation. Everyone FALLS t knees. Clare, Betsy, Scraggy and a RELUCTANT Kezure do th Sun Wu Kung PACES through the clearing. He LOOKS into the He is DISTRESSED. TROUBLED. His wrinkled face twists into expression. He RAISES his golden hooped rod to the sky. H His old voice CREAKS and GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot bury these men!... This is a garden of life... Not of death!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betsy WHISPERS to Clare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he speakin' in English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a heavenly being. According to legend, when a heavenly being speaks, men of all countries can understand him. We hear him in English...the pygmies hear him in their language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betsy NODS. Sun Wu Kung CONTINUES his heartfelt scream in heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return their souls!... I demand it!... Return their souls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few MOMENTS pass. Then...a thick, white cloud ECLIPSES small hole in the cloud, allows one RAY OF SUNLIGHT to sh The ray shines down upon ONE PARTICULAR PEACH TREE. Sun W to that peach tree. He raises the GOLDEN HOOPED ROD towar He begins to SING an unusual hymn. Suddenly, several peac FLY from the trees. They congregate ABOVE the golden hoop peaches SPIN in midair. With quick movements of the rod, SENDS several peaches flying OFF SCREEN. CAMERA FOLLOWS the magical peaches as they SEPARATE and F GRAVE. Toward the BODIES OF THE DEAD PYGMIES. Each body i individual peach. When the peaches MAKE CONTACT with the there is a small, colorful EXPLOSION. A small FIREWORKS d bodies erupt with a BRIGHT GOLDEN GLOW. A few moments PAS bodies STIRS. MOVES. The body SITS UP. Gets to its FEET. does the same. So does ANOTHER. And ANOTHER. Soon, the va CLIMB out of the graves. Their wounds have DISAPPEARED. T been RESTORED. Sun Wu Kung flings the remaining TWO PEACHES into the GRA Indiana and Bohbala. There is a small EXPLOSION...followe GLOW of their bodies. The wound in Indy's chest VANISHES. OPEN. To the delight of his friends, Indy STANDS. ALIVE. PUZZLLED by the surrounding grave. Clare, Scraggy and Bet Indiana OUT of the grave. They SHOWER him with EMBRACES a But Indy remains CONFUSED. PUZZLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Wu Kung, looking very PLEASED with himself, stands BE Clare SMILES at Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there is someone you should meet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare POINTS to behind Indy, who TURNS and sees the smili KUNG. Indy is at first SHOCKED... His face breaks into a SMILE...filled with DELIGHT. He then manages to UTTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You're... Sun Wu Kung?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Wu Kung STEPS FORWARD. He nods and ANSWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are... Indiana Jones?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Huh?... You know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I have watched you for many, many years...from the heavens. I was fascinated by your bravery...your passion...in searching for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... Thanks I'm very honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The honor is mine, Doctor Jones. You and your friends have saved my city from ruin. (a pause) I would like to return the favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Wu Kung gives Indiana the GOLDEN HOOPED ROD. Indiana PRICELESS ARTIFACT. He STARES at the beautiful rod. He is SPEECHLESS. Sun Wu Kung EXPLAINS. RAISES an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golden Hooped Rod will be a faithful friend. It is capable of one hundred transformations...and will always remain by your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy manages a NOD. Sun Wu Kung SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will explore the heavens for another. Surely, my search will be shorter and less hazardous than yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana SMILES. Meanwhile, Kezure uses the oppurtunity to SNEAK AWAY. He into a cluster of PEACH TREES. He CLIMBS the smallest tre Pirate King begins to PICK several peaches. HIDING them i pockets. Sun Wu Kung LOOKS OVER the healthy, restored community of Monkey King SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my city alive again...I will be able to return to the heavens. (warm smile to Indy and the others) Goodbye...my dear friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Wu Kung again RAISES his arms. Green ECOTPLASM again his fingers. The individual strands of HAIR fly from his reversal of what we saw only moments ago, the strands of through the air. They grow LARGER...LARGER...until they r shape of the GORILLAS. Sun Wu Kung has RETURNED to his skeletal form. He TURNS a to his resting place. The pieces of broken glass RE-ASSEM the tomb. Kezure, his pockets STUFFED with peaches, hurriedly REJOI others. Tyki EMBRACES Bohbala, glad to have his Father AL resuming his position as Ruler, LEADS HIS PEOPLE out of t Indiana, CLUTCHING his golden hooped prize, EXITS with th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana, Clare, Betsy, Scraggy, Kezure, the Pirates and C have GATHERED outside of the city walls for the journey h saying "Goodbye" to TYKI, BOHBALA And the other PYGMIES. Clare and Tyki exchange a TEARFUL FAREWELL, communicating signals. They share a final EMBRACE. Bohbala again THANKS his help. Betsy says "Goodbye" to the many GORILLAS. Bets COMMUNICATES in Gorilla hand motions and growls. Indiana, holding the Golden Hooped Rod, TURNS and moves a drawbridge. The others FOLLOW. The entire city of pygmies CHEER for their departing friends. Indy and the others DI the clouds, walking down the MOUNTAIN PATH. The Lost city the background. The drawbridge CLOSES...until the next vi ARRIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early AFTERNOON. The sun is HOT. SCORCHING. Indy and his They NAP in a shady section of the path. CAMERA PANS THE BODIES of everyone, coming to a STOP at Indiana. The Gold RESTS beside Indy. A HAND COMES INTO FRAME and GRABS the HANDS MOVE INTO FRAME. They STEAL Indy's WHIP and REVOLVE all weapons from Scraggy and his crew members. Indiana is awakened by a SWORD. At his THROAT. Indy REACH gun and whip...GONE. He LOOKS UP. KEZURE stands over him, sword in one hand, the GOLDEN ROD in another. Indy TURNS. Pirates hold SWORDS and DAGGERS at the throats of Clare, Scraggy and the crew members. Kezure TWIRLS the golden ho front of him. He SMILES at Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a wonderful treasure... Eh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves sword closer to Indy's throat) I have no deals with dead men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kezure LAUGHS. He has REMOVED a peach from his pocket. He peach on his cloak, and gives a SHRUG to Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, laughs) I am an old Pirate, Doctor Jones. Do you suddenly expect me to treat you with kindness and fairness?... It is not my way of life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is DISGUSTED. Kezure TAKES A LARGE BITE from the pea chews and swallows, Kezure NODS to his men, motioning tow the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them... (takes another bite of the peach) But save their hair. I will make a coat out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men MOVE to kill Scraggy, Betsy, Clare and the crew m Suddenly, Kezure emits a LOUD SCREAM. He GRABS his stomac FALLS to his knees. The HALF EATEN PEACH rolls from his h GROUND. Indy and Clare RUSH TOWARD Kezure. Something very STRANGE to the Pirate King... His hair begins to FALL OUT. His te skin SHRIVELS. His body becomes THINNER. SPINDLY. Kezure RAPIDLY AGE. He continues to SCREAM. In horrible PAIN. The Pirates STEP AWAY. FRIGHTENED. The others WATCH IN HO Kezure's body CONTORTS. His skin WITHERS... FLAKES... It PEEL from his bones. His screams FADE... His eyeballs ROL their sockets. Only his skeleton REMAINS. It turns BLACK TO DUST. Only his elaborate clothing REMAINS. The many st ROLL OUT of his cloak, onto the ground. The remaining Pirates DROP THEIR WEAPONS. They RUN OFF do mountain. SCARED to death! Indiana HOLDS the half eaten peach in his hand. Betsy is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the peaches promised immortality...eternal youth?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden of immortal peaches promises life only to those who are pure in heart. (pause) Kezure was evil. His heart was filled with greed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana DROPS the peach to the ground. He grabs his WHIP, GOLDEN HOOPED ROD. Scraggy and his crew members RETRIEVE weapons. Everyone TURNS, CONTINUING down the mountain pat Kezure's clothes and the several peaches behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers board a large OCEAN LINER, bound for the Unite INDIANA JONES is here. Bags PACKED. He holds a rectangula crate, covered with the words "FRAGILE". The Golden Hoope obviously STORED inside. Indy is WAITING for someone. He CHECKS his wristwach. LOOKING around. He GRUMBLES to hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Betsy?... The boat leaves in five minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HORN interrupts. Indy turns to the DIRECTION It is SCRAGGY. He is wearing DRIVING GOGGLES. He rides a bruised MOTORCYCLE, attached to a ricketty SIDECAR. The w painted on the sidecar's exterior. Scraggy PULLS UP besid Scraggy JUMPS OFF the motorcycle. Excitedly, he RUNS towa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Indy! Indy! I want to give you something for your journey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraggy FUMBLES through his pockets. He removes a small b PURPLE LIQUID. He HOLDS it out to Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take one drink before bed. It keep out all bad spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy DECLINES. He flashes a FLASK OF WHISKEY from inside pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Scraggy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this'll keep out all the bad spirits. Scraggy SHRUGS. suddenly INTERRUPTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana TURNS. BETSY and CLARE walk toward him. Indy LOOK PUZZLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're your bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?... But, you... You have to finish school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying on as Clare's assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy shoots a JEALOUS GLANCE to Clare, then back to Betsy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're MY assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more. I'm having my credits transfered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is a brilliant teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jealous) So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I don't offer a course in seduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy... I thought you wanted me out of your life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before I realized how gifted...how talented you are... I mean... I could really use you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially aboard ship for three weeks. It gets terribly lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, I've learned a lot from you. But it's time I started concentrating on a career in anthropology...instead of romance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, to Betsy) You've certainly developed a mature attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugs him) Thanks to you. (pauses, looking into Indy's eyes) You know... I always thought of you as my knight in shining armor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flattered) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now, I'll think of you as the Father I never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare WALKS up to him. She EXTENDS her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones...although your libido is questionable, your bravery and intelligence are exceptional. (a smile) It has been an honor working with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Why... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy LEANS toward Clare, as if he is going to KISS HER. H eyebrow. SPEAKING in his smoothest...most suave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Clare...there's something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer) ...something I've been wanting to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closer) ...since we first met...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEANING forward, Indy closes his eyes to KISS Clare. But AWAY. BONZO THE GORILLA enters the FRAME. BONZO KISSES In lips. Indy OPENS his eyes. He tries to MOVE AWAY. But the not move, WRAPPING HER ARMS around Indy. The Gorilla WRES the ground. By using Gorilla HAND MOTIONS and GRUNTS, Clare manages t BONZO to MOVE AWAY from Indiana. Indy WIPES his mouth. Cl and Scraggy are LAUGHING. Betsy EXPLAINS to Clare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Guess I left her cage open... she followed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ocean liner's horn SOUNDS! It begins to DRIFT away fr Indiana TURNS and RUNS up the stairs, leading to the boat a FEW FEET from the dock. Indy LEAPS onto the boat. He MA IN TIME. Indiana pauses... Suddenly UPSET. He realizes that he's F Golden Hooped Rod! It SITS on the dock. At Scraggy's FEET Ocean Liner PULLS AWAY, Indy is about to SCREAM to his fr Clare PICKS UP the crate. She SHRUGS to Indy. The ocean l FURTHER...FURTHER...from the dock. Indiana is HELPLESS. H BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clare is SOUND ASLEEP in bed. CAMERA PANS TO a corner of wooden crate holding the Golden Hooped Rod RESTS here. Su box's NAILS begin to TWIST. TURN. As if they were being t INVISIBLE HANDS. They FALL OUT of the box. DROPPING to th by ONE. The box SLOWLY OPENS. The Golden Hooped Rod SHIKM moonlight. Suddenly, the staff begins to MOVE. TWISTING. CHANGES SHAPE...turning into a GOLDEN EAGLE! The bird slo wings and FLIES OUT of the open window. INTO the night. C continues to peacefully SLEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full moon ILLUMINATES the night sky. SHIMMERING acros waters. Countless BRIGHT STARS sparkle in the night sky. LINER sails across the water. The image of an EAGLE appea night sky. SILHOUETTED against the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana Jones is SOUND ASLEEP in his bed. The room's port mysteriously SWINGS OPEN. The Golden Eagle FLIES inside. TRANSFORMS back into the Golden Hooped Rod. The rod LEANS wall. The moonlight REFLECTS the rod, SHINING into Indian Indy WAKES. He SITS UP and sees the Golden Hooped Rod. At SHOCKED. He TOUCHES the rod...then comes upon a REALIZATI CREAKY VOICE of Sun Wu Kung FILLS the SOUNDTRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golden Hooped Rod will be a faithful friend. It is capable of one hundred transformations...and will always remain by your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy STANDS. He turns and LOOKS out of the porthole. A DR SATISFIED smile covers Indy's face, as he stares at the s

dialogues.speaker: SOUND TRACK MUSIC SOARS. CAMERA PULLS BACK, TO EXTREMELY
dialogues.text: the ship SAILING across the ocean.
